Home of world-class events
What's happening in Lake Placid
Lake Placid is home to a diverse range of events, capitalizing on our open spaces,
outdoor adventures
, community spirit, and state-of-the-art venues.
Our Olympic legacy remains strong as we continue to host world-class sporting events year-round, from the
Empire State Winter Games
to
Ironman
. Soak in the excitement as you spectate high-energy competitions alongside crowds from across the country and beyond.
Live entertainment also thrives in our mountain town at the many local
taverns and restaurants
. At the
Lake Placid Center for the Arts
, visitors and locals alike will find exciting classes and dynamic performances in all seasons.
Page Copy
1dc
View all photos
close
chevron_left
chevron_right
Endless events, no matter the season
In the warmer months, events really start to heat up.
Live music and concerts
abound and our area parks and waterfront are ideal for a picnic or family get together. Spend an evening relaxing on the shore of
Mirror Lake
or take in the
fall foliage
at the annual
Oktoberfest.
Even as temperatures drop, there's still plenty to do in Lake Placid. In December, join us for the
Holiday Village Stroll
for a chance to meet Santa and celebrate the season!
There is something happening all the time in Lake Placid and the
High Peaks Region
with many more events on the calendar.

Related Contents
93c
Explore More
3 Ways To Explore Lake Placid's Top Attractions
As you begin to plan your perfect day, you will quickly learn that many of these combinations of activities can be found at just one location within the greater Lake Placid area. To give you a sampling here is a breakdown of the top 3 ways to experience.
Mountainfest: The Mountaineer’s world-class ice climbing and mountain skills event
A renowned Adirondack retailer presents Mountainfest, a celebration of all things ice and snow Mountainfest.
A Day at the Adirondack Family Book Festival
Bring the kids and your book marks! The Adirondack Family Book Festival is upon us. Get the chance to meet authors and illustrators, read new books, and discover how your favorite stories come to life!
Make Your Trip to Lake Placid Unforgettable
Not sure where to start this winter in Lake Placid? Let us help! We'll make sure you get to every iconic Lake Placid activity on your bucket list.

Home of world-class events
What's happening in Lake Placid
Lake Placid is home to a diverse range of events, capitalizing on our open spaces,
outdoor adventures
, community spirit, and state-of-the-art venues.
Our Olympic legacy remains strong as we continue to host world-class sporting events year-round, from the
Empire State Winter Games
to
Ironman
. Soak in the excitement as you spectate high-energy competitions alongside crowds from across the country and beyond.
Live entertainment also thrives in our mountain town at the many local
taverns and restaurants
. At the
Lake Placid Center for the Arts
, visitors and locals alike will find exciting classes and dynamic performances in all seasons.
Page Copy

View all photos
close
chevron_left
chevron_right
Endless events, no matter the season
In the warmer months, events really start to heat up.
Live music and concerts
abound and our area parks and waterfront are ideal for a picnic or family get together. Spend an evening relaxing on the shore of
Mirror Lake
or take in the
fall foliage
at the annual
Oktoberfest.
Even as temperatures drop, there's still plenty to do in Lake Placid. In December, join us for the
Holiday Village Stroll
for a chance to meet Santa and celebrate the season!
There is something happening all the time in Lake Placid and the
High Peaks Region
with many more events on the calendar.

As you begin to plan your perfect day, you will quickly learn that many of these combinations of activities can be found at just one location within the greater Lake Placid area. To give you a sampling here is a breakdown of the top 3 ways to experience.
Mountainfest: The Mountaineer’s world-class ice climbing and mountain skills event
A renowned Adirondack retailer presents Mountainfest, a celebration of all things ice and snow Mountainfest.
A Day at the Adirondack Family Book Festival
Bring the kids and your book marks! The Adirondack Family Book Festival is upon us. Get the chance to meet authors and illustrators, read new books, and discover how your favorite stories come to life!
Make Your Trip to Lake Placid Unforgettable
Not sure where to start this winter in Lake Placid? Let us help! We'll make sure you get to every iconic Lake Placid activity on your bucket list.

Home of world-class events
What's happening in Lake Placid
Lake Placid is home to a diverse range of events, capitalizing on our open spaces,
outdoor adventures
, community spirit, and state-of-the-art venues.
Our Olympic legacy remains strong as we continue to host world-class sporting events year-round, from the
Empire State Winter Games
to
Ironman
. Soak in the excitement as you spectate high-energy competitions alongside crowds from across the country and beyond.
Live entertainment also thrives in our mountain town at the many local
taverns and restaurants
. At the
Lake Placid Center for the Arts
, visitors and locals alike will find exciting classes and dynamic performances in all seasons.

Endless events, no matter the season
In the warmer months, events really start to heat up.
Live music and concerts
abound and our area parks and waterfront are ideal for a picnic or family get together. Spend an evening relaxing on the shore of
Mirror Lake
or take in the
fall foliage
at the annual
Oktoberfest.
Even as temperatures drop, there's still plenty to do in Lake Placid. In December, join us for the
Holiday Village Stroll
for a chance to meet Santa and celebrate the season!
There is something happening all the time in Lake Placid and the
High Peaks Region
with many more events on the calendar.

Home of world-class events
What's happening in Lake Placid
Lake Placid is home to a diverse range of events, capitalizing on our open spaces,
outdoor adventures
, community spirit, and state-of-the-art venues.
Our Olympic legacy remains strong as we continue to host world-class sporting events year-round, from the
Empire State Winter Games
to
Ironman
. Soak in the excitement as you spectate high-energy competitions alongside crowds from across the country and beyond.
Live entertainment also thrives in our mountain town at the many local
taverns and restaurants
. At the
Lake Placid Center for the Arts
, visitors and locals alike will find exciting classes and dynamic performances in all seasons.
Page Copy
1dc
View all photos
close
chevron_left
chevron_right
Endless events, no matter the season
In the warmer months, events really start to heat up.
Live music and concerts
abound and our area parks and waterfront are ideal for a picnic or family get together. Spend an evening relaxing on the shore of
Mirror Lake
or take in the
fall foliage
at the annual
Oktoberfest.
Even as temperatures drop, there's still plenty to do in Lake Placid. In December, join us for the
Holiday Village Stroll
for a chance to meet Santa and celebrate the season!
There is something happening all the time in Lake Placid and the
High Peaks Region
with many more events on the calendar.
